snippet.description: Gas is going up again, and threatening to become an election issue. Prices are still below the $147 a barrel level hit during the summer of 2008, but they are climbing. snippet.title: Crude Oil: Too Much Or Too Little?
snippet.description: The market is pricing in $90 oil in terms of major integrated oil producers' valuation. This leaves some room for an upside surprise. We don’t see $4 plus gas at the pumps and consumer disposable income is enhanced by lower energy outlays. This touches off more personal consumption, helps keep down inflation and Detroit prospers – selling [...] read »
